As his operation grows, Coughlin faces off against local gangsters, Klansmen and religious evangelicals while he fights for control of Tampa's criminal underworld. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Making of 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Maps to the Stars
programme.desc: A high-powered Hollywood family unravel after their troubled daughter returns home, years after causing a fire that nearly killed her brother. Meanwhile, the daughter develops a relationship with a limo driver, and an aging actress pines for a role that she was born to play. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Snow White A Tale of Terror
programme.desc: A grim version of the fairy tale finds the maiden (Monica Keena) threatened by her evil stepmother (Sigourney Weaver) and befriended by seven outcasts living in the forest. Will: Gil Bellows. Hoffman: Sam Neill. Peter Gutenberg: David Conrad. Lars: Brian Glover. Little Lilli: Taryn Davis. Directed by Michael Cohn. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Kill the Messenger
programme.desc: A reporter investigates a possible link between the CIA and the importing of cocaine into the U.S. in the 1980s. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Plaquemines
programme.desc: Trapped in the struggling fishing town of Plaquemines, an inquisitive boy seeks an escape despite his out-of-work father's stubborn belief that the fishing business will return, and that his son will follow in his footsteps. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: A Cure for Wellness
programme.desc: A young executive travels to a spa in the Swiss Alps to find and bring home his company's CEO. But when he digs into the truth behind the resort's "miracle cures," the staff diagnose him with the same affliction that has trapped the other guests there. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Hereafter
programme.desc: The lives of a working-class American, a French journalist and a London schoolboy intersect when their collective grief leads them on a journey to discover the truth about the afterlife. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Waitress
programme.desc: Charming tale of a pregnant small-town waitress (Keri Russell) hoping to win a pie-baking contest and leave her boorish husband. Adrienne Shelly wrote, directed and costars. Nathan Fillion, Cheryl Hines, Andy Griffith, Jeremy Sisto. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Jersey Boys
programme.desc: This musical drama chronicles the rise and fall of Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons, one of the key pop groups of the early '60s, responsible for such iconic hits as "Sherry," "Walk Like a Man" and "Big Girls Don't Cry." (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Unforgettable
programme.desc: In this female-centric thriller, a jilted ex-wife grows jealous of her former husband's new bride, and decides to destroy the latter's reputation in an attempt to get her old life back. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Blood Work
programme.desc: After his heart transplant, a retired FBI profiler tries to solve the organ donor's murder. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Good Hair
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Rock examines the role of hair in the African-American community and its far-reaching effect on cultural identity. Also: a look at the highly competitive world of black stylists. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Company
programme.desc: Robert Altman's ensemble drama about a dancer (Neve Campbell) trying to make her way to the top of a Chicago ballet troupe. Engrossing story, dazzling choreography. Malcolm McDowell. Campbell, who was once a dancer, approached Altman with the story idea. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The War of the Roses
programme.desc: This dark comedy follows the disintegration of a marriage, from happy first date to domestic discontent to a truly hellish divorce. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Going in Style
programme.desc: Three elderly friends and retired steelworkers are outraged to learn that their pension fund has been raided by a shady corporation. In response, they decide to rob one of the corporation's banks to get their hard-earned money back. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Identity
programme.desc: On a dark and stormy night, ten strangers are stranded at an isolated motel in the Nevada desert, only to learn each of them has a secret, and that their arrival at the motel has not been a matter of mere chance. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Held Up
programme.desc: An affable businessman (Jamie Foxx) gets stuck in the middle of a wacky hostage crisis inside a small-town convenience store. Rae: Nia Long. Pembry: Barry Corbin. Jack: John Cullum. Beaumont: Jake Busey. Rodrigo: Eduardo Yanez. Gloria: Julie Hagerty. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: King Arthur Legend of the Sword
programme.desc: Arthur draws the legendary sword Excalibur from the stone, and must learn to harness its power in order to lead a rebellion against his uncle Vortigern, who murdered Arthur's father and usurped the throne years ago. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Sylvia
programme.desc: Alternately brooding and impassioned biopic focusing on the troubled seven-year marriage of poets Sylvia Plath (Gwyneth Paltrow) and Ted Hughes (Daniel Craig). Paltrow brings a subtle, textured air to the role. Her real-life mother, Blythe Danner, plays her screen mom. Christine Jeffs directed. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Diner
programme.desc: The autobiographical recollections of writer-director Barry Levinson recount the story of five high-school grads on the brink of adulthood in 1959 Baltimore. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Going in Style
programme.desc: Three elderly friends and retired steelworkers are outraged to learn that their pension fund has been raided by a shady corporation. In response, they decide to rob one of the corporation's banks to get their hard-earned money back. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Orphan
programme.desc: A seemingly angelic orphan named Esther exhibits an unforeseen devilish streak shortly after arriving at her new home. Devastated by a recent miscarriage, aspiring parents John and Kate decide to adopt 9-year-old Esther. But once she's welcomed into their family, she begins to display some deeply unsettling behavior. As tragedy looms, John and Kate race to convince everyone else that Esther is pure evil. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mechanic Resurrection
programme.desc: Hit man Arthur Bishop is forced to come out of retirement and commit three difficult assassinations in order to rescue his kidnapped lover. The hardest part: He must make all of the killings look like accidents. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Dolores Claiborne
programme.desc: A big-city journalist discovers a terrible secret about her family's past after her estranged mother becomes the prime suspect in the death of the elderly woman for whom she had been caring. Soon the daughter learns the details of her father's mysterious death years before, and eventually she realizes how profoundly she misunderstood her mother. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Paradise
programme.desc: A 10-year-old spends a summer with an unhappy couple, who eventually come to care for the boy. The youngster becomes close friends with a classmate. Remake of the 1987 French film "Le Grand Chemin" ("The Big Road"). (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mondays at Racine
programme.desc: A documentary short about two sisters who set aside one Monday every month at their Long Island salon to give free beauty treatments to women who have been diagnosed with cancer. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
programme.desc: A seriocomic account of the exploits of two affable real-life outlaws trying to make a living at the turn-of-the-20th century, but discovering that banks and railroads are getting harder to rob, especially with a relentless superposse closing in on them. A Best Picture nominee. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mr. 3000
programme.desc: An arrogant baseball player leaves the game the moment he collects his 3000th hit, but, years later, when a statistical snafu is discovered and his total is lowered, the over-the-hill slugger must come out of retirement to reach the milestone and cement his place in baseball history. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Courtside at the NBA Finals
programme.desc: Chronicling the sights and sounds of the fourth consecutive NBA Finals between the Cleveland Cavaliers and Golden State Warriors. Executive produced by Bill Simmons. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Yes Man
programme.desc: A perennial naysayer becomes a guy who just can't say "no" (and won't) after attending a self-help seminar that challenges him to say yes to everything for a year. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Blade Runner 2049
programme.desc: In 2049 L.A., a cop known as K hunts down android laborers who have gone rogue. But when he uncovers a shocking conspiracy involving the robots, K searches for the one person who might have answers: a law-enforcement agent who once had his job. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Jersey Boys
programme.desc: This musical drama chronicles the rise and fall of Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons, one of the key pop groups of the early '60s, responsible for such iconic hits as "Sherry," "Walk Like a Man" and "Big Girls Don't Cry." (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: American Made
programme.desc: In this '80s-set thriller based on a true story, airline pilot Barry Seal is recruited by the CIA to smuggle drugs and weapons abroad for the U.S. government. However, Seal gets in over his head when he becomes involved with Colombia's Medellín cartel and the Iran-contra scandal. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: A rural high-school misfit, who lives with an equally odd family, helps his oddball friend run for class president. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Charlie's Angels Full Throttle
programme.desc: The trio must locate stolen rings that contain encrypted information about the Witness Protection Program. They also take on a fallen Angel who has gone over to the dark side. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Tale
programme.desc: A journalist re-examines her childhood memories after her mother discovers a story she wrote four decades earlier that detail sexual relationships she had with two adult coaches when she was 13 years old. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Postman Always Rings Twice
programme.desc: A sleazy drifter gets a job in a Depression-era diner and begins a torrid affair with the owner's much younger wife. The adulterers plot to murder the owner so they can be together. Based on the novel by James M. Cain. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Lady Day at Emerson's Bar and Grill
programme.desc: Adaptation of the 2014 Broadway hit that won Audra McDonald her sixth Tony Award for her portrayal of Billie Holiday, who, in a haunting 1959 performance in Philadelphia shortly before she died, shares her life story and sings some of her signature tunes, including "God Bless the Child," "What a Little Moonlight Can Do" and "Tain't Nobody's Business If I Do." (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: This sports-history saga is the fact-based tale of the Texas Western squad that won the 1966 NCAA basketball championship—the first team to do so starting an all-black lineup. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial
programme.desc: A lonely boy befriends a homesick alien stranded on Earth and attempts to help him find a way home. Meanwhile, a group of government scientists attempt to capture the benevolent visitor for research. Won Oscars for sound, visual effects and score. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Rachel
programme.desc: In this gothic romance set in 19th-century England, a young man falls for his alluring and secretive cousin Rachel, despite his suspicions that she murdered his guardian after altering the latter's will—or that she might be targeting him next. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The House
programme.desc: After realizing that they can't possibly afford the tuition for their daughter's college, a married couple team up with their eccentric neighbor to make money by running an illegal casino in the suburbs. Needless to say, things quickly spiral out of control as they deal with unruly guests while trying to keep their operation hidden from the police. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Wilson
programme.desc: A salty curmudgeon discovers he has a teenage daughter who has been put up for adoption by his ex-wife after their split. He tries to reunite the family, but his abrasive personality makes getting reacquainted unpleasant for everyone. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Docudrama about the Deepwater Horizon disaster, the 2010 oil-rig explosion in the Gulf of Mexico that resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in U.S. history. The film depicts the challenges that the rig's crew faced as they fought for survival. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Dinner for Schmucks
programme.desc: Tim wants to snag a big promotion at work, but to do so he must take an eccentric nutcase to his boss's dinner party, where guests are supposed to bring the strangest person they can find. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Girls Trip
programme.desc: Four gal pals decide they need to take a vacation together after five years apart, and head to New Orleans to have a wild time at the Essence Festival. There, they party hard while confronting their personal issues and romantic dilemmas. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.desc: A successful hit man reevaluates his profession while attending his high-school reunion. (cc).

programme.title: Off Air
programme.desc: (cc).

programme.title: Practical Magic
programme.desc: Two witches become the target of a detective's investigation after one of their boyfriends goes missing. (cc).

programme.title: Lara Croft Tomb Raider The Cradle of Life
programme.desc: The feisty video-game heroine goes against an evil scientist who specializes in biological weapons as they both race to find Pandora's Box. (cc).

programme.title: Drag Me to Hell
programme.desc: Ambitious L.A. loan officer Christine Brown incurs the wrath of a malevolent gypsy by refusing to grant her an extension on her home loan. Determined to get a promotion at work, Christine lays down the law when mysterious Mrs. Ganush literally begs for mercy at her feet. In retaliation, Mrs. Ganush places the curse of Lamia on her unfortunate target. Now, unless Christine can break the curse, she'll be tormented by a demon for three days before literally being dragged to hell. (cc).

programme.title: The Mummy
programme.desc: A soldier discovers the tomb of a female pharaoh named Ahmanet during a firefight in the Middle East. But when he and a British Egyptologist excavate the findings, the resurrected Ahmanet emerges from her sarcophagus with a plot to enslave humanity. (cc).

programme.title: John Wick Chapter 2
programme.desc: Hit man John Wick is once again called out of retirement, this time by a former colleague who wants him to repay a debt by killing an Italian crime lord. programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Now fully recovered from his amnesia, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne attempts to uncover the truth behind his father's death, while simultaneously exacting revenge and evading the government forces hot on his trail. (cc).

programme.desc: Dark comedy starring Demi Moore as a stripper struggling to gain custody of her daughter. Burt Reynolds. Al Garcia: Armand Assante. Shad: Ving Rhames. Darrell: Robert Patrick. Malcolm: Paul Guilfoyle. Orly: Jerry Grayson. Angela: Rumer Willis. (cc).

programme.title: Cradle 2 the Grave
programme.desc: A Taiwanese special agent teams up with a Los Angeles jewel thief after the latter's daughter is kidnapped. (cc).

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July
programme.desc: Oliver Stone's docudrama about paralyzed Vietnam vet Ron Kovic, who tries to reconcile memories of his idealistic youth with his post-war disillusionment. (cc).

programme.title: High Plains Drifter
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood's first Western as both director and star is a revenge tale that centers on a mysterious stranger who rides into a lakefront settlement, where the citizens beg him to defend them against a group of outlaws who have a score to settle with the townsfolk. (cc).

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Two soul-singing brothers are sent on a "mission from God" to raise $5000 to save a Chicago orphanage. On their fund-raising tour de force, they encounter a multitude of mishaps and mayhem. (cc).

programme.title: Spies Like Us
programme.desc: Two misfit low-level CIA agents are turned into decoys by their superiors and sent to Pakistan to distract Soviet agents from discovering the genuine American spies in the area. programme.title: Grosse Pointe Blank
programme.desc: A successful hit man reevaluates his profession while attending his high-school reunion. (cc).

programme.title: Firewall
programme.desc: This action thriller offers a high-tech twist on "The Desperate Hours" (1955, 1990). A bank-security expert must break into his own vault when robbers hold his family hostage and demand ransom. (cc).

programme.title: Murder at 1600
programme.desc: A Washington, D.C., police detective is thrown into a morass of dirty politics when he investigates the murder of a young woman at the White House. (cc).

programme.title: Strange Days
programme.desc: On the eve of the millennium, a former cop hustles virtual-reality discs that can record any human experience---including murder. (cc).

programme.desc: A troubled 9-year-old tries to convince her psychologist father that creepy recent events are the work of her imaginary friend. Although he is amused at first, the father soon becomes worried about his daughter's growing emotional problems. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: An amnesiac CIA assassin tries to piece together his life as he is hunted for elimination by his superiors. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: The cohorts of a ruthless terrorist hijack a plane to rescue him from an FBI escort, but they do not know that a terrorism expert is aboard. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Shine
programme.desc: Geoffrey Rush won an Oscar for his portrayal of piano prodigy David Helfgott, whose domineering father (Armin Mueller-Stahl) caused him to have a mental breakdown. David (teen): Noah Taylor. Gillian: Lynn Redgrave. Prof. Parkes: John Gielgud. Directed by Scott Hicks. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Envy
programme.desc: Two best friends who are also neighbors and coworkers have a falling out after one has multimillion-dollar success with a far-fetched consumer product that hits the big time and the other fails to invest in the dubious solvent, leaving him out of money. (cc).(n)

programme.title: He's Just Not That Into You
programme.desc: Relationship go-round set in Baltimore, where an interconnected group of twenty-and-thirtysomething singles and marrieds try to get to the heart of what makes for true love. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Taking Woodstock
programme.desc: Demetri Martin stars in this historical comedy-drama about the celebrated 1969 festival of peace and love. programme.desc: The Vietnam War destroys the lives of three friends who survived brutal torture by the Viet Cong. Years later, an attempt by one of the men to track down the other two reveals just how deep their mental and physical scars run. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Adaptation
programme.desc: A screenwriter tries to adapt a bestseller about a real-life orchid thief, but his neuroses get in the way of his writing. When his identical twin brother moves in and decides to become a writer, Charlie finds it even harder to finish his screenplay, a challenge made worse by his growing obsession with the original work's author. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Hangover
programme.desc: Three groomsmen awaken after a night of debauchery to learn that the groom is missing, and they attempt to find him before the wedding bells chime. With no memory of the previous night's transgressions and precious little time to spare, the trio retrace their steps and discover where things went wrong. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: Hapless, hopeless and frenetically bumbling Inspector Jacques Clouseau rides again in this tale about a murder investigation involving a famous soccer coach and the search for a one-of-a-kind jewel called the "Pink Panther." (cc).

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Prom Video
programme.desc: Monica brings some things home from her parents' house, including a prom video; Rachel tells Ross that she doesn't think it will work out between them. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross and Rachel...You Know
programme.desc: Ross's work hinders the evolution of his and Rachel's romance; Monica has eyes for an older opthalmologist (Tom Selleck); Joey and Chandler enjoy a big-screen TV. Ross: David Schwimmer. Rachel: Jennifer Aniston. Monica: Courteney Cox. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Joey Moves Out
programme.desc: Richard's relationship with a younger woman causes a stir at a party for Ross and Monica's dad; Joey decides to move out; Rachel gets a tattoo. Richard: Tom Selleck. Jack: Elliott Gould. Judy: Christina Pickles. Joey: Matt LeBlanc. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball

They immediately start fantasizing over what to spend it on. / When they find Anais training herself for a brutal showdown, Gumball and Darwin realise that their sister is being pestered at school by an annoying kid: Billy. They try to teach her how to resolve the problem peacefully, but Billy has other ideas. / When Darwin taunts Gumball about how predictable he is, Gumball tries to prove that he can still surprise his buddy. / Gumball and Darwin are devastated to learn that Mr. Robinson -- their favourite person in the world -- is selling his house and leaving town. / Mom and the kids depart for their hard day's work, leaving a seemingly lazy Dad half-asleep on the sofa. Matilda's in charge of the party food: build your own spicy sausage pitta bread sandwiches with zingy yoghurt sauce and popcorn cakes. The popcorn cakes idea came from Scarlet, a Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch viewer who emailed it to Matilda's Food Blog. programme.desc: Visiting Dr Ranj at the Children's hospital today is Petal. Petal needs the cast on her arm changing because it has got dirty and is crumbling. Petal has a fractured arm. Dr Ranj shows her an x-ray of her fractured radius. She is going to have her plaster cast replaced with a fibre glass cast. Dr Ranj cuts off the plaster cast. Petal thinks her arm is thin and smelly but this is because she hasn't been able to wash it. Dr Ranj says Petal can choose the colour of her new cast. Petal picks her favourite colour, purple. Dr Ranj puts the new cast on Petal. She loves it and sings a song with Dr Ranj about taking care of your bones and wearing a cast. Petal then gets a special sticker for having being so good during her visit.
